column5: Been a few Robins all winter, they descend on the neighbours Mt Ash berries frequently, but this morning taking the dogs around the yard for their business I heard the distinct Konk-ker -ree of a male Red Wing Blackbird up in the top of the maple , early spring I say..

I installed the new onboard charger, hooked up the fuel line of my new kicker to  the main tank, and changed out some old mono on a few poles!  Just need to load tackle, fill rod locker and put the Minnkota and riggers back on the boat and spring is happening!  First steelhead of the year was last week so ice fishing and winter can piss off!
Yeah looking forward to the southern shore of Lake O!   Time to watch those temp charts now, lol.

It seems like just a couple of weeks ago they were talking about how much ice cover was on Lake Erie? http://www.cleveland19.com/story/37606166/northeast-ohio-enjoys-early-taste-of-spring-in-parks-on-lake

A bit bitter sweet for me. I bought a new sled this winter and I haven't been able to get 500 miles on it.  On the other had, I can't wait for shallow king/trout action on Lake O's south shore. First world problems but maybe one last blast from old man winter in March (not like this hasn't happened b4) and then on to double digit temps.. Oh yea, and throw in a winning lottery ticket into the mix just for fun..LOL. A boy can dream..
Foran's launch here in town is free of ice , pier and shoreline is icefree for casting.

winter aint done yet, dont be fooled, its still february. I guaratnee theres some snow ahead for us. Once April hits though, lets get out on the water, ive got a new boat and chasing some crappies will do me just fine until pickerel and Pike opens up again.
Lmao. Stealing this.  Heard a couple of red winged blackbirds as well. Hope I can get the kayak out before my event season picks up to heavily.

Standing at the kitchen sink looking out the window a few Grackles landed in the previously mentioned maple this morning, first of the year, all the while the weatherman was talking winter storm warning on the TV.
LOL, yep spring is in the air! and the local weather forecast says to expect blizzard like conditions! March is roaring in!
yep freezing rain 5 inches of snow/ice last nite. and were in the banana belt, Windsor.. the robins look puzzled.

10" of heavy white stuff here. Took 2 sessions to clear the driveway. A neighbour was bold enough to plow out our entire street and sidewalks because the city has only once sent a plow down our street this entire winter, and that was 5 days after a storm.
Nothing here in Barrie, for once
